The system uses a microphone designed to detect the specific frequencies of an object striking glass in order to provide protection in two ways: a) in the event glass breakage is detected, an alarm will immediately sound and the starter will be disabled, or (b) if GBS senses an object striking glass-without breakage occurring - a warn-away alarm will be activated. GBS sensitivity can be adjusted to help reduce false alarms.
